text:
My mom refuses to use MacOS. The software she needs to use doesn't work on MacOS or Wine.

I did try it myself because Linux at the time wasn't in a great spot. But you still need Wine on MacOS and compiling a lot of software yourself. It was sort of like trying to use Linux but worse because MacOS itself has like... no libraries you need and no good package manager (Macports/etc don't really cut it).

I even paid for Mac OS server, but in the next OSX release Apple had removed support for it. Server software supported for a grand total of 1 year? Even unpaid Linux has a better track record.

Still, M1 would at least make it a budget laptop (cheaper than Intel/Windows for price/performance). So I would at least not tell people off when buying into it especially if they have an overpriced iPhone. But I'll stay with Ryzen/Linux for now.
